title: Rio da Yung OG Announces Tour, Drops First New Project Since Prison Release: Listen
description: The Michigan rapper celebrates his release from federal custody with the 10-track Rio Free
author: Matthew Strauss
excerpt: The Michigan rapper celebrates his release from federal custody with the 10-track Rio Free
text: Last month, Rio da Yung OG was released from federal prison and promptly celebrated with a new song called “Rio Free.” The Michigan rapper has now shared a new project called Rio Free, which includes his other recent single “WYDT.” Find the 10-song project, along with a new music video for “Off-Rap,” below.Rio da Yung OG had already lined up a homecoming show at Detroit’s Masonic Temple, for January 11, and the rapper has now announced a full U.S. tour. The concerts take place in January, February, March, and April. See Rio da Yung OG’s tour schedule below.Rio da Yung OG shared multiple projects, including Fiend Lives Matter and Rio Circa 2020, while serving time in federal prison after agreeing to plead guilty to possessing a firearm in furtherance of a drug trafficking crime. Seminal projects, like 2020’s City on My Back, preceded his incarceration.All products featured on Pitchfork are independently selected by our editors. However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.Rio da Yung OG: Welcome Home Tour 2025Rio da Yung OG:01-11 Detroit, MI - Masonic Temple01-12 Detroit, MI - html:
Last month, Rio da Yung OG was released from federal prison and promptly celebrated with a new song called “Rio Free.” The Michigan rapper has now shared a new project called Rio Free, which includes his other recent single “WYDT.” Find the 10-song project, along with a new music video for “Off-Rap,” below.

Rio da Yung OG had already lined up a homecoming show at Detroit’s Masonic Temple, for January 11, and the rapper has now announced a full U.S. tour. The concerts take place in January, February, March, and April. See Rio da Yung OG’s tour schedule below.

Rio da Yung OG shared multiple projects, including Fiend Lives Matter and Rio Circa 2020, while serving time in federal prison after agreeing to plead guilty to possessing a firearm in furtherance of a drug trafficking crime. Seminal projects, like 2020’s City on My Back, preceded his incarceration.

All products featured on Pitchfork are independently selected by our editors. However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.

Rio da Yung OG: Welcome Home Tour 2025
